content.title: Previously, it was believed that ovulation, and, accordingly, the possibility of getting pregnant happens to a woman only once a month, in the middle of the menstrual cycle. Canadian scientists have been conducting daily ultrasound examinations of 63 women for a long time and were surprised by the result.

content.text: During the study, physicians had to literally rewrite textbooks, said the head of the research team, Dr. Roger Pearson, director of the Department of Biological Reproduction Research at the University of Saskatchewan. It turned out that during one cycle, the female body is able to produce not one, as is commonly believed in traditional science, but several eggs.

In 13 of 63 women surveyed, ovulation occurred several times per cycle. In addition, it turned out that 40-50% of women have three waves of ovarian activity. Each such surge could result in the production of an egg

content.s: If you are using rhythmic methods of contraception based on calculating ovulation and abstaining from unprotected sex during periods of unsafe pregnancy, be always on the alert. Basically, the female body really plays by the rules, that is, the activity of the ovaries is consistent with the menstrual cycle. And the egg cell is born only one and at the appropriate time. However, there are exceptions, the cause of which has not yet been established by doctors.
